content:
Hello, apologies for the dumb question. Is the T-libs-impl label on github relevant to the work happening in this zulip stream?
If no, where do I find the T-libs-impl folks?
If yes, did the label on github recently change from libs-impl to T-libs-impl?
@apiraino yes and yes. we might start a t-libs/impl channel here, but for now there's just t-libs here.

oh thanks! :thumbs_up:
So I assume that from now the correct labeling all around should be T-libs-impl, right?
I am asking because the tool we use to generate some github queries still looks for the libs-impl label and I was kind of confused why I couldnt find some stuff

ah yes. there's two reasons for the change: one is that this makes it a bit easier to find the label (if people look for t-libs they also see the other one), and the other is that we're trying to start a separate libs-impl (sub)team.

totally makes sense. I'll push a small PR, now I'm sure about this :)
(I wonder if other bits around may be affected by this change :thinking: ... no idea, though)
